notesStmt.note: Damp entry at lower corner in the first half of the manuscript. Some dark tidemarks.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: Quires of mostly 12 leaves each, marked with catchwords on the last page of a quire in the latter part of the manuscript. Leaves on guards.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental semi-cursive scripts of the 15th century. Yitsḥaḳ: his name marked off on folio 128v, 194v, 195v.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine: 'Mikhlol Yofi. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2858.'
